column5: A young Troll, suspected of infidelity by an elder Troll named Knurremurre, escapes by turning into a tomcat and living comfortably in the town of Lyng. Upon hearing that Knurremurre has died, the tomcat eagerly returns to Bröndhöi, leaving behind his human host, Plat, in astonishment.
This church had it's roof ripped of 3 times by an angry ogre.
Depicted as a giant, slimy serpent or troll that obstructs travelers, it symbolizes an intangible obstacle amd featured prominently in Henrik Ibsen's Peer Gynt.
